Kongres PSSI: Persaingan Iwan Bule, La Nyalla, dan Kubu 9
01 Nov 2019, 14:15 by Irsyan Hasyim (Kontributor), Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Sembilan calon ketua umum PSSI periode 2019-2023 menuding bahwa kongres pemilihan PSSI pada 2 November 2019 berat sebelah. Mereka menduga ada salah satu calon yang diuntungkan dan kental dengan permainan uang yang melibatkan pemilik suara (voters).
Sembilan calon ketua umum PSSI ini atau kubu 9 ialah Fary Djemy Francis, Vijaya Fitriyasa, Yesayas Oktavianus, Rahim Soekasah. Lalu Arif Putra Wicaksono, Aven Hinelo, Benny Erwin, Bernhard Limbong dan Sarman El Hakim.
Indikasi kecurangan, menurut mereka, misalnya agenda debat yang sejatinya digelar pada Kamis (31 Oktober), dibatalkan. Padahal, tim sembilan menilai bahwa debat tersebut sangat penting sebagai jalan bagi para calon ketua untuk meraih perhatian para voter.
Calon Ketua Umum PSSI, Benhard Limbong, mengaku pesimistis mampu meraih suara mayoritas dalam Kongres Luar Biasa (KLB) di Hotel Shangri-la, Sabtu, 2 November 2019. Mantan Ketua Komisi Disiplin PSSI ini menduga tradisi lama untuk pemilihan ketua umum masih digunakan oleh para pemilik suara atau voters. "Semacam money politic-ku lihat begitu," kata dia saat dihubungi Tempo, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Awalnya, kata Benhard, lebih dari 10 voters PSSI telah membangun komitmen memberikan dukungan dalam kongres. Ia mengatakan, sebenarnya tak mau menuduh macam-macam kepada voters yang telah membangun komitmen.
Namun, dia melanjutkan, menjelang KLB mereka sulit dihubungi. "Ada apa? Kemarin-kemarin yang bersangkutan hubungi terus, tiba-tiba dihubungi enggak bisa lagi," kata Benhard.
Salah satu dari kubu sembilan, Fary Djemy Francis, menduga ada oknum Komite Eksekutif (Exco) PSSI yang ingin memenangkan salah satu calon ketua umum di kongres. "Terindikasi kuat adanya operasi senyap," kata Fary, Jumat, 1 November 2019.
Para kandidat Ketum juga merasa tidak mendapatkan medium untuk mendekatkan diri kepada para voter. Debat yang bisa menjadi cara untuk menarik perhatian voter malah dibatalkan. "Jika sudah begini, maka federasi kita, PSSI dan sepak bola Indonesia secara keseluruhan, dalam kondisi bahaya dan akan makin parah jika tidak ada perbaikan untuk menuju perubahan," kata Fary.
Sembilan calon ketua umum PSSI pun menaruh harapan kepada para voter. Mereka berharap para pemilik hak suara bisa menggunakan hati nurani. "Kami mengimbau para voters, semuanya, untuk menggunakan hati nuraninya. Mari kita bergandengan tangan, dengan hati yang tulus, dengan cinta, untuk membawa sepak bola Indonesia menjadi lebih baik," tutur Fary.
Di luar kubu sembilan, kandidat ketua lainnya, La Nyalla Mattalitti, menegaskan tidak akan datang ke KLB PSSI. Ia menyatakan sikapnya tidak berubah ihwal legalitas kongres pemilihan yang akan digelar 2 November 2019.
"Saya sudah sampaikan, selama kongres digelar 2 November maka saya menarik diri," kata La Nyalla, Jumat, 1 November 2019. Menurut dia, penyelenggaraan kongres pada tanggal tersebut dianggap tidak betul sehingga tak akan datang.
"Kalau saya teruskan maka saya bisa ditertawai orang, apalagi saya mantan ketua umum. Jadi tidak mungkin (hadir)," ucap pria yang juga Ketua DPD RI ini.
La Nyalla mengatakan akan datang ke kongres PSSI bila digelar pada Januari 2020. "Aturannya Januari itu. Dan saya baru mau mencalonkan. Tapi rupanya tetap berjalan 2 November, jadi mari dilihat saja besok hasilnya," kata dia.
Sejauh ini, calon ketua umum yang memiliki peluang paling besar meraih suara mayoritas ialah Mochamad Iriawan. Pria yang akrab disapa Iwan Bule itu mengaku bahwa dirinya mendapat dukungan dari 50 voters PSSI. "Mereka sudah menyampaikan dukungannya kepada saya," kata Iwan Bule dalam wawancara dengan Tempo, 2 September 2019.
Berdasarkan Kongres Luar Biasa (KLB) pada Juli 2019 lalu, voters PSSI berjumlah 86. Jumlah itu terdiri dari 34 Asosiasi Provinsi (Asprov), 18 klub Liga 1, 16 klub Liga 2, 16 klub Liga 3, Asosiasi Futsal dan Asosiasi Sepak Bola Wanita.
Dengan dukungan sekitar 50 voters, secara otomatis Iwan Bule mendapatkan suara mayoritas dengan 58 persen suara. Hal itu berpeluang menjadikannya sebagai Ketua Umum PSSI periode 2019-2023.
Sekretaris Umum Lemhanas ini enggan menyebutkan secara detail mengenai 50 voters yang bakal memilihnya. Iwan hanya menyebutkan ada 23 klub yang memberikan dukungan, 20 asosiasi provinsi dan sisanya klub di Liga 2.
Federasi sepak bola Indonesia menyatakan KLB PSSI pada 2 November 2019 sah dan telah mendapat persetujuan dari pemilik suara. Pelaksana tugas ketua umum PSSI, Iwan Budianto, menegaskan agenda kongres sudah sesuai dengan statuta PSSI 2019 serta didukung oleh federasi internasional sepak bola, FIFA.
KLB PSSI akan memilih 15 personel Exco PSSI 2019-2023, yaitu ketua umum, dua wakil ketua umum, dan 12 anggota exco. Kongres digelar pada 2 November 2019 di Hotel Shangri-La, Jakarta.

PSSI Congress: Competition of Iwan Bule, La Nyalla and Kubu 9
01 Nov 2019, 14:15 by Irsyan Hasyim (Contributor), Aditya Budiman
TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - Nine PSSI chairperson candidates for the 2019-2023 period accused that the PSSI election congress on November 2, 2019 was biased. They suspect that there is one candidate who benefits from and is thick with cash games involving voters.
Nine candidates for the PSSI general chairman or camp 9 are Fary Djemy Francis, Vijaya Fitriyasa, Yesayas Octavian, Rahim Soekasah. Then Arif Putra Wicaksono, Aven Hinelo, Benny Erwin, Bernhard Limbong and Sarman El Hakim.
Indications of fraud, according to them, for example the debate agenda which was actually held on Thursday (October 31), was canceled. In fact, the team of nine considered that the debate was very important as a way for the candidates to chair the attention of the voters.
PSSI Chairperson Candidate Benhard Limbong said he was pessimistic that he would be able to win a majority in the Extraordinary Congress (KLB) at the Shangri-la Hotel, Saturday, November 2, 2019. vote owners or voters. "I see that kind of money politics," he said when contacted by Tempo, Friday, November 1, 2019.
Initially, said Benhard, more than 10 PSSI voters had built a commitment to provide support in the congress. He said, actually did not want to accuse various kinds of voters who had built commitments.
However, he continued, ahead of the KLB they were difficult to contact. "What's wrong? Yesterday, the person concerned continued to contact, suddenly contacted could not be anymore," said Benhard.
One of the nine camps, Fary Djemy Francis, suspected that there was a PSSI Executive Committee (Exco) who wanted to win one of the candidates for the general chair in the congress. "There are strong indications of silent operations," Fary said, Friday, November 1, 2019.
Ketum candidates also felt they did not get the medium to get closer to the voters. Debates that could be a way to attract voters' attention were canceled. "If you have this, then our federation, PSSI and Indonesian football as a whole, are in danger and will get worse if there is no improvement to change," said Fary.
Nine PSSI general chairmen also put their hopes in the voters. They hope that the voters can use their conscience. "We urge the voters, all of them, to use their conscience. Let's join hands, with a sincere heart, with love, to bring Indonesian football to be better," said Fary.
Outside the nine camps, another chairman candidate, La Nyalla Mattalitti, asserted he would not come to KLB PSSI. He stated that his attitude had not changed regarding the legality of the election congress which would be held on November 2, 2019.
"I have already said, during the 2 November congress that was held that I withdrew," La Nyalla said, Friday, November 1, 2019. According to him, the organization of the congress on that date was considered incorrect so it would not come.
"If I continue then I can be laughed at by people, moreover I am a former chairman. So it is not possible (to be present)," said the man who is also the Chairman of the DPD RI.
La Nyalla said that he would come to the PSSI congress if it was held in January 2020. "The rules are in January. And I just want to nominate. But apparently it still runs November 2, so let's just look at the results tomorrow," he said.
So far, the candidate for chairman who has the greatest chance of winning a majority vote is Mochamad Iriawan. The man who is familiarly called Iwan Bule admitted that he had the support of 50 PSSI voters. "They have expressed their support to me," Iwan Bule said in an interview with Tempo, September 2, 2019.
Based on the Extraordinary Congress (KLB) in July 2019, PSSI voters numbered 86. That number consisted of 34 Provincial Associations (Asprov), 18 League 1 clubs, 16 League 2 clubs, 16 League 3 clubs, Futsal Association and Women's Football Association .
With the support of around 50 voters, Iwan Bule automatically won a majority of votes with 58 percent of the votes. It has the opportunity to make him the General Chair of PSSI 2019-2023.
The Lemhanas General Secretary was reluctant to mention in detail the 50 voters who would vote for him. Iwan only mentioned that there were 23 clubs that provided support, 20 provincial associations and the rest were clubs in League 2.
The Indonesian Football Federation declared the PSSI KLB on November 2, 2019 to be valid and had received approval from the voting owner. Acting chairperson of PSSI's general chair, Iwan Budianto, stressed the congress agenda was in accordance with the 2019 PSSI statutes and supported by the international soccer federation, FIFA.
KLB PSSI will elect 15 Exco PSSI 2019-2023 personnel, namely the general chairman, two deputy chairmen, and 12 exco members. The congress will be held on November 2, 2019 at the Shangri-La Hotel, Jakarta.
